extendedInfo.description: SteamCalc is a chemical engineering application that calculates properties of water steam using IF97 formulation. Valid inputs are pressure and temperature. Output properties are volume, density, entropy, enthalpy, and internal energy. A must have for chemical engineering students. Don't waste your time flipping through pages of steam tables.

reviews.title: GIVES WRONG ANSWERS
reviews.comment: If you enter P=43 bar and T=400 degrees C you get enthalpy = 1379.9 BTU/lb.  If you enter the same properties using a different temperature unit (P=43 Bar and T=752F) you get enthalpy =1583.1 BTU/lb.  This tool does not work.  Please fix it.
reviews.author: Andrew Gentile

reviews.title: Free
reviews.comment: Basic but good enough for beginners. TY very much
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wrong answers.
reviews.comment: UNINSTALLING. Gives obviously wrong answers. Android steam tables (free) is much better
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: It would be better if you could select more inputs.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Accurate
reviews.comment: Accurate information. Bit you can only choose temperature and pressure rather than choosing any 2 inputs.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Gives erroneous results
reviews.comment: Checked pressure and vapor as the two inputs.  Entered pressure at 14.7 psi and the app spit out a saturation temperature of 416\302\260F when is should be 212\302\260F.  In addition, the psi units should read psia.  Didn\'t check any of the other calculations since a single error makes this app not-qualified for it\'s intended use.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Very simple to use. Quick and easy
reviews.author: A Google User
